parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: VISIT
fields.questionText: What is the visit name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of the laboratory tests were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the laboratory tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the Laboratory CRF using the date (LBDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether or not lab specimen was collected or measurement performed.
fields.definition: An indication of whether or not a planned lab measurement, series of lab measurements, test, or observation was performed or specimens collected.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be implemented for an entire panel, or on a specific test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
fields.label: Lab Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable LBSTAT. If the CDASH variable LBPERF = "N", the value of LBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If LBPERF = "Y", LBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., LBCAT and LBSCAT, LBTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD would be populated as LBALL and an appropriate test name (LBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: LBPERF
fields.questionText: Was the sample collected?; Was the lab performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date of specimen collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required. The SDTMIG LBDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.
fields.label: Specimen Collection Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: LBDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the lab specimen collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record time of collection (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis or a specimen is collected over an extended time period.
fields.label: Specimen Collection Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: LBTIM
fields.questionText: What was the (start) time of the lab specimen collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the lab test category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBCAT and or LBSCAT should be included if lab status (NOT DONE) is collected for each lab category (e.g., HEMATOLOGY, CHEMISTRY, URINALYSIS).
fields.label: Category for Lab Test
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: LBCAT
fields.questionText: What was the name of the lab panel?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the lab test subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the LBCAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBSCAT can only be used if there is an LBCAT and it must be a subcategorization of LBCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Lab Test
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: LBSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the name of the lab sub-panel?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBTPT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the planned time point labels for the lab test, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Lab Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time point anchors LBTPTREF (text description) and LBRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables LBTPTNUM, LBELTM.
fields.name: LBTPT
fields.questionText: What was the planned time point of the lab?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBFAST

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.
fields.definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
fields.implementationNotes: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. This may not be relevant for all tests.
fields.label: Lab Fasting Status
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: LBFAST
fields.questionText: Was the subject fasting?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBCOND

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether protocol defined testing conditions were met.
fields.definition: Indication whether the testing condition defined in the protocol were met (e.g., Low fat diet).
fields.implementationNotes: This information is collected when the laboratory test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be preprinted on the CRF (e.g., "Did subject meet diet requirements?"). This may not be relevant for all tests.
fields.label: Lab Test Condition Met
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPLB dataset as the value of SUPPLB.QVAL where SUPPLB.QNAM = "LBCOND" and SUPPLB.LABEL="Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: LBCOND
fields.questionText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78733

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBSPCCND

fields.completionInstructions: Record condition of specimen.
fields.definition: Description of the condition of the specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be collected using free or standardized text. Results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met. When local processing is used, sponsors may not routinely collect specimen condition.
fields.label: Lab Specimen Condition
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: LBSPCCND
fields.questionText: What was the condition of the specimen?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C67154

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBTEST

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Lab Test or Examination Short Name

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the Lab measurement or finding, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name of the lab test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test.
fields.implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Lab Test or Examination Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in LBTEST. The SDTMIG variables LBTESTCD and LBTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: LBTEST
fields.questionText: What was the lab test name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBORRES

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

self.title: Lab Result or Finding in Original Units

fields.completionInstructions: Record laboratory test result.
fields.definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.
fields.label: Lab Result or Finding in Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: LBORRES
fields.questionText: What was the result of the lab test?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85492

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBMETHOD

self.title: Lab Method of Test or Examination

fields.completionInstructions: Record the method of Test or Examination.
fields.definition: Method of the test or examination.
fields.implementationNotes: This information may be collected when more than one method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.
fields.label: Lab Method of Test or Examination
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: LBMETHOD
fields.questionText: What was the method used for the lab test or examination?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBORRESU

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere. For some lab tests the units may not be applicable (e.g., urine color).
fields.label: Lab Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: LBORRESU
fields.questionText: What was the unit of the lab result?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBCRESU

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received if it were collected as a non-standard unit.
fields.implementationNotes: The collected, non-standard unit(s) should be reported as an equivalent standard unit in LBORRESU.
fields.label: Lab Collected Non-Standard Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. The collected, non-standard unit(s) may be submitted in a supplemental qualifier dataset.
fields.name: LBCRESU
fields.questionText: What was the unit of the lab result?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBTOXGR

fields.completionInstructions: Record the Toxicity Grade.
fields.definition: The toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE).
fields.implementationNotes: This is commonly used in oncology trials but sponsors may not collect these toxicity grades on CRFs. Terminology codes lists (TOXGRV3) and (TOXGRV4) are available for use.
fields.label: Lab Standard Toxicity Grade
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.
fields.name: LBTOXGR
fields.questionText: What is the Toxicity Grade?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBTOX

fields.completionInstructions: Record the description of the toxicity.
fields.definition: A description of toxicity quantified by LBTOXGR (e.g., NCI CTCAE Short Name).
fields.implementationNotes: This would typically be the text description quantified by LBTOXGR (e.g., HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA)
fields.label: Lab Toxicity
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.
fields.name: LBTOX
fields.questionText: What is the description of the toxicity?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

priorVersion.title: Lab Normal Range Lower Limit- Original Unit

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBORNRLO

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Reference Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit

self.title: Lab Ref Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit

fields.completionInstructions: Record the lower limit of the reference range of the lab test.
fields.definition: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in LBORRES.
fields.implementationNotes: LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI should be populated only for continuous results; LBSTNRC should be populated only for non-continuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be determined from a site or lab specific set of normal ranges stored in a look up table. See the SDTMIG for details on mapping and selecting the proper variable name.
fields.label: Lab Ref Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: LBORNRLO
fields.questionText: What was the lower limit of the reference range for this lab test?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

priorVersion.title: Lab Normal Range Upper Limit- Original Unit

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBORNRHI

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Reference Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit

self.title: Lab Ref Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit

fields.completionInstructions: Record the upper limit of the reference range of the lab test.
fields.definition: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in LBORRES.
fields.implementationNotes: LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI should be populated only for continuous results; LBSTNRC should be populated only for non-continuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be determined from a site or lab specific set of normal ranges stored in a look up table. See the SDTMIG for details on mapping and selecting the proper variable name.
fields.label: Lab Ref Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: LBORNRHI
fields.questionText: What was the high limit of the reference range for this lab test?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78736

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBNRIND

fields.completionInstructions: Record where the lab result fell with respect to the reference range (e.g. HIGH, LOW, ABNORMAL).
fields.definition: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
fields.implementationNotes: Reference ranges may be defined by LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI or other objective criteria. Typically for local processing "Reference Range Indicator" may be derived or determined programmatically and is not collected on the CRF. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
fields.label: Lab Reference Range Indicator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: LBNRIND
fields.questionText: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBCLSIG

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether lab results were clinically significant.
fields.definition: An indication whether lab test results were clinically significant.
fields.implementationNotes: May be included if required by the protocol.
fields.label: Lab Clinical Significance
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPLB dataset as the value of SUPPLB.QVAL where SUPPLB.QNAM= "LBCLSIG" and SUPPLB.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: LBCLSIG
fields.questionText: Was this result clinically significant?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBNAM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the laboratory name.
fields.definition: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
fields.implementationNotes: Recommended to collect on the CRF if lab names was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple labs are used by a site.
fields.label: Vendor Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: LBNAM
fields.questionText: What was the name of the laboratory used?
